00028 void printUsage(void)
00029 {
00030     std::cout << "Usage: createSpriTree  [--with5RMSCut] [--ahcConfig ahc.cfg] "
00031               << " [--outfile outfile.root] run1 [run2] ..."  << std::endl;
00032     std::cout << "  Create a root file with the TSprectrumPropertiesRunInfo (spri) trees." <<std::endl;
00033     std::cout << "  For each run there is a tree named spriTree_runnumber." << std::endl;
00034     std::cout << std::endl;
00035     std::cout << "  Optional arguments:" <<std::endl;
00036     std::cout << "  The optional arcuments must be given before the run numbers." << std::endl;
00037     std::cout << "  --ahcConfig\t Specify the ahcConfig file. If not given it is required that" 
00038               << " the mapping was done in ahcBinHst" <<std::endl;
00039     std::cout << "  --outfile\t Name of the output root file."
00040               << " If none is given the name is run1_tree.root." <<std::endl;
00041     std::cout << "  --with5RMSCut\t Apply iterative 5*RMS cut on histograms before filling the tree"
00042               << std::endl;
00043 }

00045 void printChannelStatusMap( std::map< int, int > const & channelStatusMap , std::ostream & s = std::cout )
00046 {
00047   s << "# module chip channel status "<< std::endl;
00048   s << "# ATTENTION: Currenlty this is the expert status, which by chance is identical "<< std::endl;
00049   s << "# to the status written to the data base. "<< std::endl;
00050   for ( std::map< int, int >::const_iterator mapIter= channelStatusMap.begin();
00051         mapIter != channelStatusMap.end(); mapIter++)
00052   {
00053     // the first entry in channelStatusMap is the channel, the second one the status
00054     SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID channelID = SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelID( mapIter->first );
00055     s << channelID._module << "\t"
00056       << channelID._chip << "\t"
00057       << channelID._channel << "\t"
00058       << "0x" << std::hex <<  mapIter->second << std::dec << std::endl;
00059     // the channel status is put out in hex, so the states can be seen manually
00060   }
00061   s << "#total number of bad channels: " <<  channelStatusMap.size() << std::endl;
00062 }
00063 
00064 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00065 {
00066   // check that there are arguments, otherwise give usage
00067 
00068   if (argc == 1) // no arguments given
00069   {
00070     printUsage();
00071 
00072     return 1;
00073   }
00074 
00075   static const unsigned int maxOptions = 3;
00076   
00077   // a variable of the first argument containig a run number
00078   size_t firstRunArgument = 1; 
00079 
00080   std::string ahcConfigFileName;
00081   std::string outfileName;
00082   bool use5RMSCut = false;
00083 
00084   for (unsigned int option(0); option < maxOptions; option++)
00085   {  
00086     if (firstRunArgument == unsigned(argc))
00087     {
00088       break;
00089     }
00090 
00091     // check for the options 
00092     if ( std::string(argv[firstRunArgument]).compare("--ahcConfig") == 0 )
00093     {
00094       ahcConfigFileName =  std::string(argv[firstRunArgument+1]);
00095       firstRunArgument+=2;
00096     }
00097     else if( std::string(argv[firstRunArgument]).compare("--outfile") == 0 )
00098     {
00099       outfileName =  std::string(argv[firstRunArgument+1]);
00100       firstRunArgument+=2;      
00101     }
00102     else if( std::string(argv[firstRunArgument]).compare("--with5RMSCut") == 0 )
00103     {
00104       use5RMSCut = true;
00105       firstRunArgument+=1;      
00106     }
00107     else
00108     {
00109       //no options
00110       break;
00111     }
00112   }
00113 
00114   if (firstRunArgument == unsigned(argc))
00115   {
00116     std::cout << "Error, no runs specified" << std::endl;
00117     std::cout << std::endl;
00118     printUsage();
00119     return 2;
00120   }
00121 
00122   // check if first run argment starts with a number, in case of typos...
00123   if ( !isdigit(argv[firstRunArgument][0]) )
00124   {
00125     std::cout << "Error, first run number is not a digit. Do you have a typo?" << std::endl;
00126     std::cout << std::endl;
00127     printUsage();
00128     return 3;
00129   }
00130   
00131   if (outfileName.empty())
00132   {
00133     // create the root file name from the first run number
00134     std::stringstream fileNameStream;
00135     fileNameStream << argv[firstRunArgument] << "_tree.root";
00136     outfileName = fileNameStream.str();
00137   }
00138 
00139   // some debug stuff
00140   std::cout << "ahc config is " <<( ahcConfigFileName.empty()? "not used." : ahcConfigFileName )
00141             << std::endl;
00142   std::cout << "output file is " << outfileName  << std::endl;
00143   std::cout << "use5RMSCut is " << (use5RMSCut?"true":"false") << std::endl;
00144   std::cout << "runs ";
00145   for ( size_t run = firstRunArgument; run < unsigned(argc); run ++)
00146   {
00147     std::cout << argv[run] << "\t";
00148   }
00149   std::cout << std::endl;
00150 
00151   // phew, alot of overhead for a short programme.
00152   // Now we can start the real thing
00153 
00154   // try to open the root file. Append to it
00155   TFile outfile( outfileName.c_str(), "UPDATE" );
00156 
00157   for ( size_t run = firstRunArgument; run < unsigned(argc); run ++)
00158   {
00159     SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo spri( atoi(argv[run]), ahcConfigFileName, use5RMSCut );
00160     
00161     TString treeName("spriTree_");
00162     treeName+=argv[run];
00163     
00164     outfile.cd();
00165     spri.getSpectrumPropertiesTree()->Write(treeName);
00166   }
00167   
00168   outfile.Close();
00169 
00170   return 0;
00171 }
